context: The college is launching a new e-course titled "Doing the Work: An Introduction to Anti-Racism." This course is accessible to both students and employees through Brightspace for students and Cornerstone for employees. All members of the college community are encouraged to take this self-directed course, which provides an introduction to race, racism, and anti-racism concepts. Incoming students will be automatically enrolled in the course on Brightspace. Completing the e-course is a part of the college's efforts to integrate race-conscious principles and values of Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion throughout the community. The Anti-Racism learning and development initiative aims to address racial and social inequities and ensure meaningful inclusion for all members.

George Brown College requires new students and staff to complete an Anti-Racism e-course as part of their onboarding process. The course is accessible through Brightspace for students and Cornerstone for employees. All incoming students are enrolled in the course, and staff are expected to complete it within the first 90 days of employment. The e-course aims to help individuals understand anti-racism values and principles within the George Brown College context.

Key facts:
- The Anti-Racism e-course is mandatory for new students and staff.
- Students can access the course on Brightspace, while employees can find it on Cornerstone.
- Incoming students will find the e-course on their Brightspace home page once they have registered for courses.
- Staff and faculty have 90 days from their employment start date to complete the e-course.
- The Anti-Racism e-course is part of George Brown College's commitment to anti-racism and racial equity efforts.
- Interested groups can enroll students in the e-course using a provided form.
- For more information, individuals can explore the college's anti-racism action plan on their website.

The Office of Anti-Racism, Equity & Human Rights Services (OAREHRS) at George Brown College provides resources, training, and educational opportunities on anti-racism. These offerings can be accessed through their microsite and email newsletter. OAREHRS also offers education that can be requested via a form on their Education page. The office can be reached via phone at 416-415-2000 or TTY at 1-877-515-5559, and emails can be sent to ask.george@georgebrown.ca. For more information, visit their social media hub. The information on the website is subject to change without notice. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
